page.title: 03MILL GREEN MUSEUM
page.content:
LOCAL HISTORY 'MILL GREEN MUSEUM'
A mill has stood on this site at Mill Green for at least nine hundred years because it was mentioned in the first Domesday Book Joseph Biggs and his family worked the mill for 98 years from l726 to l824. The Farr family rented the mill from l824 to l894. There are dates and initials on the building relating to mill repairs by the millers. The last millers to work the mill were called Lawrence but they left for Canada in l9ll. The Mill House was a council house until l973 then it became a museum owned by the local council. Two rooms have displays of home life and old games and other local subjects. Another room has temporary exhibitions. Between l973 and l978 parts of the
